title: Tips for silkscreening tee shirts?
content:
Anyone have any tips / know of any good guides?

I'm very comfortable with printing on paper, but haven't attempted cloth / tees...

Thanks.
author: fredcastle

comments.content: less colours is a lot easier to work with. limit your design to 2 or 3 colours.

Check pp. 96-103 might be of some interest to you :  
 [http://www.betamag.ee/beta04/beta04\_eng.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20100824150112/http:/www.betamag.ee/beta04/beta04_eng.pdf "http://www.betamag.ee/beta04/beta04\_eng.pdf")
If you are going to print images (photos), think that you need lower 'lineature'. Most offset are done as 150 or 175 lines per inch. On silk screen you would need less, say 133, maybe less.
